intro: Amanoa divaricata, commonly known as the Hawaiian moonflower, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its fragrant, white, night-blooming flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often have a slightly waxy texture. Amanoa divaricata is adapted to the tropical climate of Hawaii and plays a role in the local ecosystem.
